articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China is willing to work with Indonesia to strengthen cooperation, further consolidate the framework of independent collaboration, jointly address risks and challenges, and promote common development, Premier Li Qiang said on Sunday.
articles.title: China wants to work with Indonesia to tackle risks, challenges, Premier Li says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fragments from a Russian drone triggered a fire and caused damage to an apartment building in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv early on Sunday, a senior Ukrainian official said.
articles.title: Russian drone fragments set Kyiv apartment building ablaze, official says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mahmoud Issa
articles.description: Mervat Hijazi and her nine children didn't eat at all on Thursday - save her underweight baby who had a sachet of peanut paste.
articles.title: Diary of a Gazan family's descent toward starvation

articles.author: Akash Sriram
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened once again on Friday to ramp up his trade war, recommending a 50% tariff on European Union goods starting June 1 and warning Apple he may impose a 25% tariff on any iPhones manufactured outside the U.S.
articles.title: Trump's renewed trade threats take aim at European Union, Apple

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two settlements in Donetsk region and one in Sumy have been captured, the Russian Defence Ministry said.
articles.title: Russia says it captures 3 more settlements in east Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French police were investigating a possible arson attack as being the main cause for a power outage which hit the Alpes-Maritimes region in southern France on Saturday, including Cannes which is hosting its world-famous annual film festival.
articles.title: Police probe possible arson attack as Cannes and parts of southern France suffer power cut

articles.author: Katie Tam, Angie Teo, Ann Wang
articles.description: With an admission letter in hand, Taiwanese student Yu-hsuan Lin was ready to attend her dream school, Harvard University, this September.
articles.title: Taiwan students heading to Harvard 'anxious' after US enrolment block

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: Business heir Daniel Noboa was sworn in for a full term as Ecuador's president on Saturday, promising to press the South American country's fight against drug gangs and boost sluggish economic growth.
articles.title: Ecuador's Noboa vows to reduce murders, boost economy at inauguration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany may consider reintroducing military conscription from as soon as next year if it does not attract enough volunteers for its armed forces, Defence Minister Boris Pistorius told the Frankfurter Allgemeine Sonntagszeitung on Saturday.
articles.title: German defence minister does not rule out return of military draft, he tells FAS

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has detained shipyard officials responsible for a recent major accident during the launch of a new warship, state media said on Sunday.
articles.title: North Korea detains officials over warship accident, state media says
